benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Retrieve account tags

covered: Valid Request: Happy path returns 200 with application/json and a JSON array of Tag objects; defaults (includedDeleted=false, audit=NONE) verified (TC01).
Query Parameters: includedDeleted and audit exercised individually and together (FULL, MINIMAL, combo), invalid audit value handled (400), unknown param tolerated (TC02–TC05, TC09–TC10).
Empty Response: Account with no tags returns an empty JSON array (TC06).
Error Scenarios (per story): 400 for invalid accountId format and edge cases; 404 for non-existent account (TC07–TC08, TC20–TC22).
Authorization: 401 covered for missing and invalid tokens (TC12–TC13).
Resilience/Integration: API unavailability (503) and downstream failure (502) covered; regression checks included (TC11, TC18–TC19, TC24–TC25).
Security negatives: SQL injection-like and XSS attempts rejected with 400 (TC14–TC15).
Performance/Concurrency: Large result set and concurrent requests validated with timing expectations (TC16–TC17).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No verification of ETag/If-None-Match, Cache-Control/Expires headers, or 304 Not Modified.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios to validate 429 Too Many Requests or X-RateLimit-* headers under burst traffic.
Pagination: Not addressed; if the endpoint supports pagination, tests for limit/offset and Link headers are missing (clarify spec).
Authorization breadth: No 403 Forbidden/insufficient permissions scenario (e.g., valid token without required scope/tenant).
Contract/schema validation: Tag object shape per #/definitions/Tag is not asserted (required fields and types).
Content negotiation: No tests around Accept header handling (e.g., unsupported media types -> 406) or charset on Content-Type.

Query param robustness: No tests for includedDeleted with invalid values (e.g., includedDeleted=foo) or explicit includedDeleted=false; no explicit audit=NONE or enum case-sensitivity/whitespace handling.
Data-state edge case: Account with only deleted tags not covered (includedDeleted=false -> empty; includedDeleted=true -> deleted tags returned).
Error payload contract: Structure/content of error responses (code, message, details, correlation ID) not validated.
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: capture ETag on first GET; repeat with If-None-Match to assert 304; verify Cache-Control/Expires headers.
Add rate-limiting tests: send bursts to confirm expected behavior (429 with X-RateLimit-* headers, or documented absence of throttling).
If supported, add pagination tests: limit/offset parameters, Link headers, boundary conditions (limit=0, max limit), and invalid values.
Add 403 Forbidden test using a valid token lacking required role/scope or tenant headers, per security model.
Validate response contract: assert Tag object fields against the API schema (JSON Schema), including types and required properties.
Add content negotiation tests: Accept: application/json works; unsupported Accept (e.g., application/xml) yields 406 or documented fallback.
Harden query param tests: explicit includedDeleted=false; includedDeleted=foo -> 400; audit=NONE explicitly; verify enum case sensitivity and trimming behavior.
Cover data-state where only deleted tags exist: verify includedDeleted flag behavior toggles result set as expected.
Assert error payload schema and avoid leakage of stack traces; verify standard error fields are present and localized if applicable.
Use realistic UUIDs in steps (e.g., 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000) to strictly exercise the UUID regex pattern.
Broaden performance criteria: capture p95/p99 latency and payload size; add memory/time-out assertions for very large tag sets.
Clarify and codify behavior for unknown query params (ignore vs reject) and assert accordingly in tests.
